abstract_summ: All the patients in the ward received comprehensive psychological intervention, including telephone psychological counseling (active and passive), self-adjustment of written materials and one-to-one psychological crisis intervention.Almost half of students reported anxiety levels ranging from mild to severe with females reporting higher anxiety scores during hospital visits (OR=2.02, 95% CI,1.41 to 2.91) and medical students reporting lower anxiety levels in comparison to dental students (OR=0.61, 95% CI,0.45 to 0.84).Understanding the psychological impact on psychiatric patients during the COVID-19 pandemic has the potential to provide insight into how to develop a new immunopsychiatry service.Introduction: The COVID-19 pandemic is likely to increase anxiety levels within the community and in particular medical students who are already considered psychologically vulnerable groups.Objective:The present study aimed to investigate and analyze the psychological status of patients with COVID-19 during the course of illness, and to evaluate the effect and influencing factors of psychological crisis intervention, so as to explore the effective mode of clinical psychological intervention in acute patients under isolation environment.
title_summ: IMPACT OF COVID-19 PANDEMIC ON MENTAL HEALTH OF MEDICAL STUDENTS:A CROSS-SECTIONAL STUDY USING GAD-7 AND PHQ-9 QUESTIONNAIRESAnalysis of psychological state and clinical psychological intervention model of patients with COVID-19Trauma-spectrum symptoms among the Italian general population in the time of the COVID-19 outbreak.A Case-Control Study with Service and Research Implications for ImmunopsychiatrySevere psychological distress among patients with epilepsy during the COVID‐19 outbreak in southwest ChinaPsychological status and fatigue of frontline staff two months after the COVID-19 pandemic outbreak in China: A cross-sectional studyCOVID-19 quarantine: Post-traumatic stress symptomatology among Lebanese citizensImpact of quarantine due to COVID infection on migraine: a survey in Genova, ItalyA Study on Immediate Mental Health Status and Psychoneuroimmunity Prevention Measures of Chinese WorkforceDo psychiatric patients experience more psychiatric symptoms during COVID-19 pandemic and lockdown?Increased levels of anxiety among medical and non-medical university students during the COVID-19 pandemic in the United Arab Emirates.Is Returning to Work during the COVID-19 Pandemic Stressful?
title_abstract_phrases: All the patients in the ward received comprehensive psychological intervention, including telephone psychological counseling (active and passive), self-adjustment of written materials and one-to-one psychological crisis intervention.Almost half of students reported anxiety levels ranging from mild to severe with females reporting higher anxiety scores during hospital visits (OR=2.02, 95% CI,1.41 to 2.91) and medical students reporting lower anxiety levels in comparison to dental students (OR=0.61, 95% CI,0.45 to 0.84).Analysis of psychological state and clinical psychological intervention model of patients with COVID-19Background:Patients with the 2019 coronavirus disease (COVID-19) have different degrees of psychological pain, such as anxiety and depression, which may related to their prognosis.Do psychiatric patients experience more psychiatric symptoms during COVID-19 pandemic and lockdown?Understanding the psychological impact on psychiatric patients during the COVID-19 pandemic has the potential to provide insight into how to develop a new immunopsychiatry service.
